Key Match Events: Baris Yilmaz received a red card after a second yellow card and was sent off (WAL 0-0 TUR)
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy made his debut as Wales manager with a Nations League match against Turkey, aiming to implement a new style of play
Wales were expected to perform well under Bellamy's leadership, but faced a tough opponent in Turkey who had recently performed well at Euro 2024
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy expressed pride in the team's performance but was frustrated with the goalless draw
Wales showed promising signs and controlled possession but failed to break down a resilient Turkish defense
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first for Wales under new manager Craig Bellamy
Wales had 15 shots but only one on target, highlighting their finishing issues
Turkey's 10-man situation in the second half added complexity to the game
Others: The match was played at Cardiff City Stadium
The weather was rainy, affecting play slightly
